alert.note: Alert for Casey; Russell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 5:02PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Lincoln, Russell and southeastern Casey Counties through 545 PM EDT/445 PM CDT/... At 501 PM EDT/401 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles east of Liberty to near Jamestown. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of Russell, southern Lincoln and southeastern Casey Counties, including the following locations... Eli, Lawhorn Hill, Windsor, Teddy, Webbs Cross Roads, Gilpin, Karlus, Walltown, Russell Springs and Cantown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
